chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy M Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Register as a sexual offender.

No contact with anyone under age 18 without agent approval.

Not to use internet or possess any hardware, software, or other devices which access internet or download without agent approval.

No email address or passwords without agent approval.

May only use work provided equipment for work purposes in conforming with employment restrictions.

Enter into, participate, and successfully complete any assessments determined by agent.
AODA and followthrough.
Absolute sobriety.  No class B establishments, including beer tents.

May travel outside state for work only, but agent may modify.

timeConds.notes:
w/work release; credit for 3 days served
May serve in Oconto County if accepted.  Give DNA sample - completed.
May go to his home to use the office there for work purposes only while on work release.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy M Brooks in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge receipt of the PSI and evaluation.  No corrections to the PSI.  Arguments and remarks regarding sentencing by Atty. Parker and Atty. Kohn.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Citizenship, voting, and/or firearms information provided and admonitions given.  Appeal rights given.

Sentence:  w/h sentence - 5 years probation
Conditions:  1 year jail w/work release with 3 days credit; $10.00 fine + costs; $250.00 DNA SC and give sample.
Other conditions:  Register as a sexual offender.
No contact with anyone under age 18 without agent approval.
Not to use internet or possess any hardware, software, or other devices which access internet or download without agent approval.
No email address or passwords without agent approval.
May only use work provided equipment for work purposes in conforming with employment restrictions.
Enter into, participate, and successfully complete any assessments determined by agent.
AODA and followthrough.
Absolute sobriety.  No class B establishments, including beer tents.
May travel outside state for work only, but agent may modify.
letter from Judge Kussel to Attorney Kohn - PSI

Defendant Timothy M Brooks in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PLQ filed w/guilty plea.  DA Parker - parties agree to PSI & Psycho Sexual  analysis.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  DA Parker - believes court should note "fictitious child".  Court so notes. DE pleads guilty.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty .  PSI & Psycho Sexual exam order.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on December 5, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 2, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Timothy M Brooks in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remarks by Atty. Parker regarding potential settlement.  There may be a future request for postponement.  Discussion re: discovery and witness lists.  No anticipated motions in limine.  Parties reminded to contact the court no later than 24 hours prior to trial if any changes.  Discussion regarding bond condition.  Bond to continue.

Final pre-trial at 02-19-2016 11:15 am.
Jury trial at 03-09-2016 08:15 am.
Order to Amend Bond - defendant permitted to travel to Abilene Kansas 7-25-15 for father's burial and shall return to WI no later than 7-27-15
Transcript of preliminary hearing held on May 11, 2015

AMENDED CONDITIONS:
DE can travel to MI for work purposes and posess phone for business calls/emails and ipad for business use.  
DE can tranvel to NE for father's funeral (dates to be set)  
No contact with anyone under 18  
Absolute Sobriety,  
NO entry into any Class B  establishments.  Personal laptop may be used for bisness only, must compy with employers policy, law enforcement (DE agrees) can search laptop randomly,   
DE must bring laptop to ALL future hearings.

Defendant Timothy M Brooks in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kohn waives reading of Information and enters NG plea.  
MOTION TO AMEND BOND CONDITIONS:
Atty Kohn - requests DE be allowed to travel to Nebraska for Father's funeral in addition to formal motion filed.  Court reads original motion - to expand use of electronic equipment for business purposes.  Atty Kohn and DE explain purpose of request.  Court questions DE.  ADA Niemi does not have issue with device not connected to Internet.  Court does not have issue with use of Ipad & business email account, questions use of laptop State re: monitoring.Atty Kohn -DE does not object to law enforcement checking/monitoring computer use.  Court allows DE 3 weeks to travel to NE, Atty Kohn to forward actual dates to Court, with order. Court does not object to use of ipad, personal laptop maybe used for business purposes only and must comply w/employers computer use policy, law enforcement can search computer (DE agrees) randomly or by request.  DE must bring laptop to ALL future hearings.

AMENDED CONDITIONS:
DE can travel to MI for work purposes and possess phone for business calls/emails and ipad for business use.

No contact with anyone under 18

No entry into any Class B  establishments.  Personal laptop may be used for business only, must comply with employers policy, law enforcement (DE agrees) can search laptop randomly,   
DE must bring laptop to ALL future hearings.

Absolute sobriety.
No Class B establishments.

Defendant Timothy M Brooks in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attny Kohn requests to modify bond to travel for work outside the State as well as possess a phone for calls and business e-mails.  Court grants request but to use only business e-mail account.  Arraignment scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

no possession of any devices that can access the Internet, no travel outside the State without prior approval, no contact with anyone under 18, absolute sobriety, no Class B establishments serving alcohol.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old.  Absolute sobriety.  No entry into class B licensed establishments serving alcohol.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.  No possession of any device that can access the internet.

Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge in court.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Timothy M Brooks appeared by video means.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
